newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore share index ends down, OTC perks up.
newsitem.headline: Singapore share index ends down, OTC perks up.

text.p: Singapore blue chips ended mostly weaker Friday but interest in Malaysian issues traded over the counter was relatively buoyant.
Dealers said profit taking and lack of fresh buying incentives dampened index-linked counters. Foreign investors are expected to continue to stay cautious next week, they said.
"After all the positives we've had, trade figures and good demand for executive condominiums, institutionals were a bit disappointing," a dealer with a local bank said.
The Straits Times Industrials Index (STII) ended down 6.35 points at 2,055.36 on a total turnover of 221 million shares.
Malaysian issues drew better retail interest, with the UOB OTC index posting a gain of 9.23 points to 1,168.06.
Singapore property stocks, however, received a boost encouraged by news of high bids for government land.
Keppel Land rose Singapore 12 cents to S$4.10, while Hong Fok firmed 10 cents to S$2.67 and City Developments rose 10 cents to S$12.70.
Losers included Cycle & Carriage down 20 cents to $14.40, Van der Horst shed 12 cents to S$3.78 and Singapore Technologies, down 10 cents at S$3.86.
